function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of consideration for interactions between populations in nearby localities and mobility networks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overreliance on reduced-form statistical approach without consideration of underlying mechanisms and processes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deployment of anti-contagion policies in response to high total numbers of cases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing public knowledge affects study results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on confirmed infections may overlook hospitalizations and deaths","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of statistical methods and randomization in experiments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in data collection and availability","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate or incomplete data reporting sources","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data scraping from non-official sources","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Manual data collection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on news articles and press releases for data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete reporting of subnational cases in iran from 2 to 3 march 2020","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on multiple sources for policy data in the united states","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited update of confirmed cases by region on the public health website of france until 25 march","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Policies not uniformly applied across administrative units","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fractional application of policies within administrative units","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of local travel ban accompanying home isolation policies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of accompanying policies for home isolation in different countries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate or incomplete epidemiological data","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex and unobserved process of infection rate generation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the effect of large-scale policy on behavior and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in estimating the value of local derivatives in infection rate equations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exponential growth of infections in the initial phase of an epidemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited proportion of immune individuals in the population","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Time-varying policy affecting growth rate of infections","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unbalanced panels in the data due to different start dates for testing for covid-19 in localities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on the assumption of constant exponential growth in early infection rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conditional independence assumption between policy deployments and infection growth rates may not hold in real-world contexts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of multiple regression to estimate the growth rate of infections","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Omitting day-of-week effects in china due to the timing of covid-19 outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incorporating single-day dummy variables for abrupt changes in covid-19 testing availability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Policy variables not fully enacted","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Grouping of policies may obscure specific effects","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited sample of data for estimating policy impact","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Policy variables at a more granular level than infection data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited quantity of data available","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-normal distribution of residuals","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Idiosyncratic events within a country, such as holidays or backlog in testing laboratories, could generate nonuniform country-wide changes in infection growth for individual days.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Systematic underreporting of infections is a major concern in the ongoing pandemic, which can lead to inaccurate estimates of the true infection rate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Systematic underreporting not affecting estimates for the effects of policy","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in testing regimes over space and time biasing infection growth rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Temporal underreporting generating sizable biases in estimated effects of anti-contagion policies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transient response of infection growth rates following policy deployment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Imposing assumptions regarding the temporal structure of policy effects","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data availability and shorter periods of observation in other countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assuming zero latent period for covid-19 infectiousness","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Minor potential impact of seir dynamics on coefficients recovered by empirical approach","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of simulated data to test statistical model accuracy","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Daily growth rates of infections without policy interventions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in cumulative infection estimates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
